name: Abominom
description: Abominoms  are enemies in the Philips CD-i game The Faces of Evil.

name: Arwing
description: Arwings are unused enemies in Ocarina of Time.

name: Aruroda
description: Arurodas are scorpion-like enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Baby Dodongo
description: Baby Dodongos are enemies in Ocarina of Time.

name: Arrow Trap
description: Arrow Traps are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Babusu
description: Babusu are shadow beings in A Link to the Past. They appear in the Ice Palace.

name: Baba Serpent
description: Baba Serpents are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Armos Warrior
description: The Armos Warrior is the Sub-Boss of Skull Dungeon in Oracle of Ages..

name: Arrgi
description: Arrgi are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Arrgi go unnamed in Ancient Stone Tablets.

name: Arpagos
description: Arpagos are recurring flying dragon-like enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Armos Knight
description: Armos Knights are recurring Boss and Mini-Boss in The Legend of Zelda series. They are bigger and stronger versions of standard Armos.

name: Daira
description: Daira are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series. They are expert axe-throwers, and their axes are able to slice through most Shields, making them more dangerous than those enemies who wield conventional swords or spears.

name: Cursed Lizalfos
description: Cursed Lizalfos are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Craykling
description: Crayklings are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: The Dark Imprisoned
description: The Dark Imprisoneds are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Treasure Octorok
description: Treasure Octoroks are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Whirling Scythe
description: Whirling Scythes are sharp, rotating traps in Ocarina of Time. Similar traps made of ice, known as Ice Blades or Ice Fans, also appear in the Ice Cavern.

name: Zant Mask
description: Zant Masks are an enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Zombie
description: Zombies are enemies in Link's Awakening.

name: Sky Octorok
description: Sky Octoroks are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Stinger
description: Stingers are manta ray-like enemies in Ocarina of Time. They inhabit moist environments, primarily in Inside Jabu-Jabu's Belly and the Water Temple.

name: Stone Pebblit
description: Stone Pebblits are Enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Stalkoblin
description: Stalkoblins are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Stalfos Warrior
description: Stalfos Warriors are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Stalfos Gel
description: Stalfos Gels are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Stagnox
description: Stagnox is a recurring Boss in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Spiny Chuchu
description: Spiny Chuchus are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Green Bubble
description: Green Bubbles are enemies in Ocarina of Time.

name: Pink Eyeball Monster
description: Pink Eyeball Monsters are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Pikku
description: Pikku are enemies in A Link to the Past.

name: Spear Throwing Soldier
description: Spear Throwing Soldiers, also known as Spear Soldiers, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are a variation of the enemy Soldiers that attack with spears or tridents. Spear Soldiers come in several types; some will charge after Link with their spears, akin to the Sword Soldiers, while others may throw their spears as javelins at him instead.

name: Spark
description: Sparks are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Snowball
description: Snowballs are recurring Objects in The Legend of Zelda series. They are mounds of snow that often appear as hazards, usually as rolling balls that run over Link. Occasionally they also appear as harmless objects that may conceal other objects or items.

name: Snap Dragon
description: Snap Dragons are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Goomba
description: Goombas are enemies in Link's Awakening. They are directly based on the Goomba enemies from the Mario series.

name: Golden Moblin
description: Golden Moblin are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Golden Lynel
description: Golden Lynels are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Gold Ball and Chain Soldier
description: Gold Ball and Chain Soldiers, also known as Gold Ball and Chain Troopers, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Pendulum
description: Pendulum are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Parasitic Tentacle
description: Parasitic Tentacles are limbs of Barinade that attach inside Jabu-Jabu's body in Ocarina of Time.

name: Orb Monster
description: Orb Monsters are enemies in Link's Awakening DX.

name: Sky Guardian
description: Sky Guardians are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Skullrope
description: Skullropes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Skull Kid
description: Skull Kids are recurring creatures in The Legend of Zelda series. Navi implies that children who wander into the Lost Woods become Skull Kids. One first interacts with Link in Ocarina of Time, and later plays a major villainous role in Majora's Mask. Skull Kids dress in a red cloak and hat covering an underlayer of clothing composed of a straw-like material, and play a flute, which they can also use as a weapon to shoot projectiles.

name: Sidestepper
description: Sidesteppers  are enemies appearing in The Faces of Evil. Sidesteppers appear only in Lupay and have an odd way of moving around. They hop from side to side making odd faces during the brief moment that they are standing still. Like most enemies in the game, they are rather weak and can be defeated with a single strike from Link's sword.

name: Shell Carrier
description: Shell Carriers are enemies in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland that appear in Cape Treasure and the Gooey Swamp. They are aggressive and will leap out from udder their shells to angrily attack Tingle if they spot him in his territory. They tend to drop Large Shells when defeated, however Tingle can only obtain this item by attacking it while it remains in its shell. As such, he should sneak up on them while they are asleep.

name: Gleeok
description: Gleeoks are recurring Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a dragon with multiple heads named Gleeok Heads. If the Gleeok Heads are struck enough they detach and fight independently until the body is finally defeated.

name: Giant Goponga Flower
description: Giant Goponga Flowers are enemies in Link's Awakening. They are dangerous plants which live in Goponga Swamp.  These nuisances will launch harmful fireballs to all who pass, and even so much as touching them will inflict pain. For Link to rid the area of these monstrosities, he must grab BowWow, who can eat them in a single chomp, allowing him to pass by. Alternatively, he could use the Magic Rod or the Hookshot to kill them.

name: Giant Brothers
description: The Giant Brothers are a trio of Hinox brothers in Breath of the Wild. They consist of a red hinox , a blue hinox  and a black hinox .

name: Gerune
description: Gerunes are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Ghost
description: Ghosts are recurring characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Mushroom Men
description: Mushroom Men  are enemies that appear in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They are toadstools that can pop out of the ground and walk. They usually tend to move when Tingle is at a distance. They are the only source for mushroom ingredients.

name: Molgera Larva
description: Molgera Larvae are enemies in The Wind Waker.

name: Moldworm
description: Moldworms are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Zol
description: Zols are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Zant
description: Zant  is one of two main antagonists in Twilight Princess. He is the self-proclaimed King of Twilight, although Midna claims he is the King of Shadows. He is a member of the Twili who usurps the throne of the Twilight Realm from Midna before the events of Twilight Princess. He regularly appears wearing a helmet that conceals his face, but removes it before his battle with Link. He is a powerful sorcerer and minion of Ganondorf.

name: Shadow Deku Baba
description: Shadow Deku Babas are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Sentrobe
description: Sentrobes are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Sea Monster
description: The Sea Monster is an enemy appearing in Zelda's Adventure.

name: Sandworm
description: Sandworms are enemies in Phantom Hourglass. They are giant worm-like guardians on Isle of Gust, their apparent purpose to guard the Sacred Windmills; however, they also inhabit the Temple of Wind.

name: Geldarm
description: The Geldarm is a large centipede-like bug that is common to the desert regions of The Adventure of Link.

name: Frost Pebblit
description: Frost Pebblits are miniature versions of the Frost Talus in Breath of the Wild.

name: Freezor
description: Freezors are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Moblin
description: Moblins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are among the most common enemies throughout the series, having appeared in the majority of games, and are prolific in Ganon's army. Early in the series, Moblins originally resembled anthropomorphic bulldogs, but beginning in A Link to the Past, have increasingly acquired more pig- and goblin-like features. In all of their appearances, Moblins are characteristically depicted as using spears or javelins as their main weapon. They are abundant in forests but also occasionally appear inside mountains and dungeons.

name: Mimic Mole
description: The Mimic Mole is an enemy featured in Zelda's Adventure.

name: Medusa
description: Medusa are a type of Stone Statue that appear in Dark World dungeons of A Link to the Past, dungeons in Ancient Stone Tablets, and Lorule dungeons of A Link Between Worlds.

name: Malice Naydra
description: Malice Naydra is an enemy in Breath of the Wild.

name: Magmanos
description: Magmanos are enemies and mini-bosses in Skyward Sword.

name: Yellow Zol
description: Yellow Zols are enemies in A Link to the Past.

name: Big Skulltula
description: Big Skulltula are enemies in Ocarina of Time.

name: Cyclone
description: Cyclones, also known as Whirlwinds, are recurring Objects in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Yellow Stalfos Knight
description: Yellow Stalfos Knights are Minibosses in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Crow
description: Crows are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are small, dark birds similar to their real-life counterparts, but are dangerous and aggressive, lying in wait to swoop down on passing travelers. They are also known for stealing shiny items such as Keys and Rupees. They are closely related to Takkuri and Dacto. They first appeared in A Link to the Past.

name: Yellow Gargoyle
description: Yellow Gargoyles are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Dark Fi
description: Dark Fis are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Sand Crab
description: Sand Crabs are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Tree Mimic
description: Tree Mimics are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Rupee Wraith
description: Rupee Wraiths are enemies in Four Swords.

name: Whirlpool
description: Whirlpools are recurring elements in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Running Crab
description: Running Crabs are aggressive coconut crabs commonly found in various shoreline and sandy areas of Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Wizzrobe
description: Wizzrobes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Rock
description: Rocks, also known as Stones, are recurring Objects in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Red Zol
description: Red Zols are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Red Zols go unnamed in Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch.

name: Zoro
description: Zoro are enemies in A Link to the Past.

name: Force Like
description: Force Likes are enemies in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Sky Watcher
description: Sky Watchers are enemies in Skyward Sword. Along with the Guardians, they patrol and protect the Silent Realm.

name: Fokkeru
description: Fokkeru are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Spiked Thwomp
description: Spiked Thwomps are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Their name and appearance comes from the Thwomp enemies of the Mario series.

name: Flying Fish
description: Flying Fish are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Zora
description: The Zora, also known as the Zora Tribe, are a race in The Legend of Zelda series. The Zora are an aquatic folk who possess fish and amphibian like traits, including fins, webbed feet and gills, which allow them to swim and thrive underwater. Zora can come in many shapes and sizes, but are most commonly depicted as humanoids with long tail fins on their heads and finned appendages on their arms and legs. They are protectors of water.

name: Stalmaster
description: Stalmasters are recurring Sub-Boss and enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Flame Trap
description: The Flame Trap is a ball of flame that acts as a trap in Oracle of Seasons and Oracle of Ages.

name: Stalhound
description: Stalhounds are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Fire Keese
description: Fire Keese are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are a variation of the Keese that are enveloped in fire. Fire Keese behave identically to their regular counterparts, but are significantly more dangerous as they can potentially set Link on fire upon contact. Their bodies' flames can also destroy wooden objects, such as Wooden Shields, provided they are currently equipped.

name: Fire Bubble
description: Fire Bubbles are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Staldra
description: Staldras are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Stal
description: Stals are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lynel
description: Lynels are recurring lion centaur-like enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Loccasin
description: Loccasins are enemies in Zelda's Adventure.

name: Spume
description: Spumes are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Like Like
description: Like Likes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Spiny Beetle
description: Spiny Beetles, also known as Hoarders, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Gray Zol
description: Gray Zols are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Winged Octorok
description: Winged Octoroks are enemies in Link's Awakening.

name: Phantom Eye
description: Phantom Eyes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They serve as spies for the much more lethal Phantoms who roam the Temple of the Ocean King and the Tower of Spirits.

name: White Tektite
description: White Tektites are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Spiked Beetle
description: Spiked Beetles are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: White Boe
description: White Boes are enemies in Majora's Mask.

name: Spear Moblin
description: Spear Moblins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are a named variant of the Moblin that uses spears to attack. Depending on the game, they may either charge at Link with their spears or throw them as javelins.

name: Red Rupee Like
description: Red Rupee Likes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Red Rupee Likes go unnamed in Phantom Hourglass and A Link Between Worlds.

name: Red Orb Monster
description: Red Orb Monsters are enemies in Link's Awakening DX.

name: Soldier
description: Soldiers, also known as Hylian Soldiers, and Hyrulean Soldiers, are the recurring group of warriors, law enforcers, and protectors in The Legend of Zelda series. Soldiers go unnamed in Majora's Mask 3D.

name: Red Goriya
description: Red Goriyas are enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Snowball Hinox
description: Snowball Hinox are enemies in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Red Darknut
description: Red Darknuts, also known as Red Dark Nuts, are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Goponga Flower
description: Goponga Flowers are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Eyeroc
description: Eyeroc are enemies in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Golden Monster
description: Golden Monsters are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are much more difficult to defeat than their regular counterparts, with improved speed, power or health. In return, the reward for defeating these rare monsters is substantially higher. Their appearance is usually tied to the activation of an event, such as a Kinstone Fusion in The Minish Cap.

name: Ergtorok
description: Ergtoroks are enemies in Spirit Tracks. They are a form of Octive that live in the Sand Temple.

name: Golden Darknut
description: The Golden Darknut is an enemy in Oracle of Seasons.

name: Electric Wizzrobe
description: Electric Wizzrobes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Gold Phantom
description: Gold Phantoms are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Goht
description: Goht is the Boss of Snowhead Temple in Majora's Mask. It is a giant mechanical creature with resemblence to a goat or bull. It is not only the one who is responsible for keeping the second of the Four Giants prisoner. But also Goht's curse that is causing the abnormally long and cold winter at Snowhead, which threatens the lives of the native Gorons living there.

name: Lakitu
description: Lakitus are enemies in The Minish Cap. They are directly based on the Lakitu enemies from the Mario series.

name: King Bulblin
description: King Bulblin is a recurring boss in Twilight Princess.

name: Oyster
description: Oysters are large mollusk-like creatures that appear on the First Continent in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. Regular Oysters are found on Sunshine Seashore and yield pearls  which can be snatched from their open mouths. While stealing their pearls, Tingle must be cautious not to have them clamp down on him, causing him to lose 15 Rupees. Tingle can be freed from the Oyster's grip by tapping it with the stylus.

name: Keese
description: Keese are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Joelle
description: Joelle, also known as Jo, is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series. She is one of the four Poe Sisters.

name: Iron Knuckle Captain
description: Iron Knuckle Captains are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Water Octorok
description: Water Octoroks are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Wallmaster
description: Wallmasters, also known as Wall Masters, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Wallmasters go unnamed in Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch.

name: Vapora
description: Vapora are the mini-bosses of the Shrine of Air in Zelda's Adventure. They are cloud-like monsters that take the shape of a face.

name: Red Camo Goblin
description: Red Camo Goblins are enemies in Link's Awakening.

name: Red Bubble
description: Red Bubble are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Quick Moblin
description: Quick Moblina are enemies in Nintendo Land.

name: Pyrup
description: Pyrups are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Eel
description: The Eel is an enemy appearing in the "Fairies in the Spring" episode of The Legend of Zelda TV series.

name: Dynalfos
description: Dynalfos, also known as Dinolfos, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Diving Mole
description: Diving Moles are enemies in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They appear in Lon Lon Meadow. They come up out of the ground momentarily and then return. As such, they do not directly attempt to attack Tingle. They will drop Power Garlic when defeated and are the only means of locating this ingredient.

name: Devalant
description: Devalants are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They both appear and behave similar to that of a larval Antlion.

name: Igneo Talus Titan
description: The Igneo Talus Titan is a boss in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC pack.

name: Icy Big Poe
description: Icy Big Poes are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Ice Gimos
description: Ice Gimos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Ice Chuchu
description: Ice Chuchus, also known as Ice ChuChus, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Helmet Chuchu
description: Helmet Chuchus, also known as Helmet ChuChus, are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Orange Lizalfos
description: Orange Lizalfos are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Torch Slug
description: Torch Slugs are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are flame-based mollusks that inhabits volcanic areas and the catacombs of several dungeons.

name: Torch Phantom
description: Torch Phantoms are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Oinker Captain
description: The Blue Oinker Captain and the Red Oinker Captain are large pig-like enemies that appear in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland, and are boss-like variants of the more common Oinker. Together, they guard the second area of the large Oinker camp in Auros Ruins. Both Captains are only armored lightly and attack much more aggressively with their pairs of scimitars than their shorter cousins.

name: Sky Fire Chain Soldier
description: Sky Fire Chain Soldiers are enemies in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Thorn
description: Thorns are traps in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Skullfish
description: Skullfish are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are skeletal fish that are similar in behavior to piranhas.

name: Thief
description: Thieves are recurring enemies and characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Dark Aeralfos
description: Dark Aeralfos are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Purple Gargoyle
description: Purple Gargoyles are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Silver Bokoblin
description: Silver Bokoblins are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dacto
description: Dactos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Prankster Poe
description: Prankster Poes are enemies in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Shell Jelly
description: Shell Jellies are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Cucco
description: Cuccos are recurring Animals in The Legend of Zelda series. They are well known for attacking Link if he attacks them for an extended period of time, and are sometimes known as the Cucco's Revenge Squad.

name: Dark Fiery Aeralfos
description: Dark Fiery Aeralfos are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Pokey
description: Pokeys are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are directly based on the Pokey enemies from the Mario series.

name: Gohma
description: Gohmas are recurring Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series. They are usually depicted as large, one-eyed arthropods and often shown as mothers of the Gohma Larvae. They are among the most recurring Bosses in the series since its conception.

name: Gibo
description: Gibos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are star-shaped creatures consisting of an outer body and an inner core. They occasionally separate from each other when they move. Link cannot harm the core nor the body when they are together, but they become vulnerable when separated. Hitting the core causes the Gibo to be defeated.

name: Technoblin
description: Technoblins are Enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Poison Mite
description: Poison Mite are enemies in Twilight Princess. They are small insects similar in appearance to a scarab beetle.

name: Deadrock
description: Deadrocks are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are bipedal, rock-based creatures that typically make their home on mountain ranges, such as Death Mountain. When hit by a weapon such as a Sword, they will briefly morph into impenetrable rock statues and remain in that state for a few moments before transforming back into their normal, mobile form. Their statue form renders them invulnerable to nearly all attacks.

name: Giant Bubble
description: Giant Bubbles are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Giant Bubbles go unnamed in Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch.

name: Cow
description: Cows are a recurring species in The Legend of Zelda series. They are Hyrule's primary source of Milk, and are kept in the land's various farms. A few Cows seem to strangely possess the ability to talk, such as speaking to Link.

name: Wolfos
description: Wolfos are recurring enemies in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Dark Zant
description: Dark Zants are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Ghast
description: The Ghast is an enemy in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Yomo Medusa
description: Yomo Medusa are traps in A Link to the Past.

name: Dark Tingle
description: Dark Tingles are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Ocean Octorok
description: Ocean Octoroks, also known as Octoroks, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Skytail
description: Skytail are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Myu
description: Myu are enemies in The Adventure of Link. They use spikes on their upper side to defend themselves and impale their enemies and preys.

name: Dark Sheik
description: Dark Sheiks are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Moth
description: Moths are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Spiked Iron Ball
description: Spiked Iron Balls are traps in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Gyorm
description: Gyorms are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are snail-like enemies that hide in a protective, spiked shell that hovers above ground. They can only be attacked by forcing them outside of their shells.

name: Molluska
description: Molluskas are enemies in Zelda's Adventure.

name: Stalmoblin
description: Stalmoblins are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Guardian Stalker
description: Guardian Stalkers are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Guardian Scout III
description: Guardian Scouts III are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Stone Statue
description: Stone Statues are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Moby
description: Moby are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Guard Troop
description: Guard Troops are Enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Stalfos Rider
description: Stalfos Riders are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Shadow Vermin
description: Shadow Vermin are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Taros
description: Taros are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are bull-like soldiers with horned heads found in the Dark World in A Link to the Past and Lorule in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Shadow Insect
description: Shadow Insects, also known as Twilit Insects, Insects of Darkness, and Dark Insects, are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Stalfos Mage
description: Stalfos Mages are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Switch Mole
description: Switch Moles are traps in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Sentrobe Bomb
description: Sentrobe Bombs are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Stalchild
description: Stalchildren are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Squiddy
description: Squiddies are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sea Trap
description: Sea Traps are traps in Phantom Hourglass. They are barbed, double wires held in place by two sea urchins that infrequently surfaces upon the sea of the World of the Ocean King while Link is traveling. Although it is possible to attack the two urchins that bind the wires with the cannon, it is much easier to just boat-jump over them, in a similar way that Epona does in terms of horse jumping in Ocarina of Time and Twilight Princess, on solid ground. Since they're immobile, it's also an option to stop and change course to avoid them completely.

name: Super Aeralfos
description: Super Aeralfos are enemies in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Pink Zol
description: Pink Zols are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Green Chuchu
description: Green Chuchus, also known as Green Chus, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sarcophagus
description: Sarcophagi are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Pink Gel
description: Pink Gels are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Green Bokoblin
description: Green Bokoblins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Green Bokoblins go unnamed in The Wind Waker.

name: Geldman
description: Geldmen are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Dark Manhandla
description: Dark Manhandlas are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Phantom Rider
description: Phantom Riders are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Gargantuan Ball
description: Gargantuan Balls are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series.  Gargantuan Balls also have a smaller variant, called Balls, that also make an appearance in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Phantom
description: Phantoms are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They serve as guardians for the Temple of the Ocean King and the Tower of Spirits in Phantom Hourglass and Spirit Tracks, respectively.

name: Froak
description: Froaks are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Dark Impa
description: Dark Impas are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Spearfish
description: The Spearfish are enemies appearing in The Faces of Evil and The Wand of Gamelon. These fish enemies have the ability to fly, similar to Seahats . Their only means of attack is to fly straight into either Link or Zelda.

name: Moa
description: Moas are flaming eyeball ghosts that appear in The Adventure of Link.

name: Dark Gohma
description: Dark Gohmas are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Snurgle
description: Snurgles are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Mini Death Bug
description: Mini Death Bugs are enemies in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. smaller versions of the Death Bug boss and are found primarily in the Insect Cavern of Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They are beetles driven with a wild desire for Rupees.

name: Green Spinut
description: Green Spinuts are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Green Rupee Like
description: Green Rupee Likes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Green Rupee Likes go unnamed in Phantom Hourglass and A Link Between Worlds.

name: Megmat
description: Megmats are enemies in The Adventure of Link. They appear to be of marsupial and vermin origin.

name: Snowball Zirro
description: Snowball Zirros are enemies in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Slime Minion
description: Slime Minions are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Green Gibdo
description: Green Gibdos are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Manhandla Stalk
description: Manhandla Stalks are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Dark Cucco
description: Dark Cuccos are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Golden Tektite
description: Golden Tektites are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Magtail
description: Magtails are enemies in The Wind Waker.

name: Yiga Blademaster
description: Yiga Blademasters are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dark Argorok
description: Dark Argoroks are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Golden Lizalfos
description: Golden Lizalfos are enemies in Breath of the Wild. They are exclusive to the Master Mode included in The Master Trials DLC Pack.

name: Yellow Stalfos Gel
description: Yellow Stalfos Gels are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Yellow Keaton
description: Yellow Keaton are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Chief Soldier
description: Chief Soldiers are Sub-Bosses in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Gold Skulltula
description: Gold Skulltulas, also known as Spiders of the Curse, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are gold-backed Skulltulas that, when defeated, leave behind a Token or Golden Skulltula Spirit.

name: Cheep Cheep
description: Cheep Cheeps, also known as Cheep-Cheeps,  are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are directly based on the Cheep-Cheep enemies of the Mario series.

name: Pengator
description: Pengators are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.  They appear as a hybrid of Alligator and Penguin. They can be commonly found in cold regions.

name: Wrecker Phantom
description: Wrecker Phantoms are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Peahat
description: Peahats, formatted as Pea Hat in the Nintendo 64 version of Majora's Mask, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Chain Chomp
description: Chain Chomps are recurring enemies and Animals in The Legend of Zelda series. They are dog-like creatures in the shape of an iron ball with fangs, usually attached to a chain to keep them from charging, hence their name. They are directly based on the Chain Chomp enemies of the Mario series.

name: Orange Moblin
description: Orange Moblins are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Bumper
description: Bumpers are recurring traps in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sancromy
description: Sancromies  are enemies in The Faces of Evil.

name: Business Scrub
description: Business Scrubs are recurring Deku Scrubs in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Oinker Wizard
description: Oinker Wizards are pig-like enemies that appear in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They are a variant of the more common Oinker. They shoot different projectiles at Tingle that can stun him for a second, and try to keep their distance at same time, making it complicated to attack more than one at a time.

name: Ropa
description: Ropas are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Octorok
description: Octoroks , also known as Red Octoroks, and Water Octoroks, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Octoroks go unnamed in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Bow Soldier
description: Bow Soldiers are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are a variation of the enemy Soldiers that shoot Arrows at Link with either a Bow or a Crossbow.

name: Rock Chuchu
description: Rock Chuchus, also known as Rock ChuChus, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: ReDead
description: ReDeads, also known as the Lurkers in the Dark, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are tall, zombie-like monsters. While their appearance changes from game to game, their behavior has remained relatively the same - namely their tactic of staying in place and using a petrifying gaze to freeze nearby intruders in their tracks. While their prey is stunned, they will walk over and attack. ReDeads are typically common to the 3D console Zelda games, but have also appeared in the 2D-styled game, Tri Force Heroes.

name: Boon
description: Boons are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They appear as giant flies.

name: Silver Moblin
description: Silver Moblins are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Bombling
description: Bomblings are enemies and items in Twilight Princess.

name: Silver Darknut
description: Silver Darknuts, also known as Darknuts, and Dark Nuts, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Red Wisp
description: Red Wisp, also known as Whisps, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Bokoblin Captain
description: Bokoblin Captains are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Fokka
description: Fokka are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Shrouded Stalfos
description: Shrouded Stalfos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are Stalfos that wear robes. They have a significantly different fighting strategy compared to other Stalfos, as they throw spears or shoot Arrows.

name: Gohma Egg
description: Gohma Eggs are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Flying Pot
description: Flying Pots are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series. Flying Pots go unnamed in The Minish Cap.

name: Bokoblin
description: Bokoblins, also known as Red Bokoblins, are recurring enemies in the The Legend of Zelda series. They are common infantry units utilizedalongside Moblins or Bulblinsby antagonists such as Ganon. They can be defeated with most conventional weapons.

name: Floor Spikes
description: Floor Spikes are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series. Floor Spike go unnamed in The Minish Cap.

name: Blue Wisp
description: Blue Wisp are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Gimos
description: Gimos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Blue Sword Soldier
description: Blue Sword Soldiers are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Fire Toadpoli
description: Fire Toadpolis are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Giant Fish
description: The Giant Fish is an enemy featured in the "Fairies in the Spring" episode of The Legend of Zelda TV series.

name: Fire Chuchu
description: Fire Chuchus are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ghini
description: Ghini,  also known as Light Ghini, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Octoballoon
description: Octoballoons are Enemies in A Link to the Past.

name: Madderpillar
description: Madderpillars are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Blue Pengator
description: Blue Pengators are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Armos
description: Armos, also known as Soldier Statues, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are stone or mechanical statues that come to life and attack. Their weaknesses, attack methods, and habitats vary significantly between games. In the majority of games however, Armos are initially inactive, and will activate and charge once disturbed. Inactive Armos are commonly referred to as Armos Statues. Some Armos are also explosive, and will self-destruct after being attacked. Armos come in several variations, with notable ones including Armos Knights, Death Armos, the Armos Warrior and Totem Armos.

name: Nejiron
description: Nejirons are enemies in Majora's Mask.

name: Lorule Ball and Chain Soldier
description: Lorule Ball and Chain Soldiers are Sub-Bosses of Lorule Castle in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Blue Lynel
description: Blue Lynels are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Cursed Moblin
description: Cursed Moblins are Enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Boo
description: Boos are enemies in Link's Awakening. They are directly based on the Boo enemies from the Mario series.

name: Blue Goriya
description: Blue Goriyas are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lightning Lock
description: Lightning Locks are recurring magical barriers in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Mounted Miniblin
description: Mounted Miniblins are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Cursed Bokoblin
description: Cursed Bokoblins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are an undead variant of Bokoblin.

name: Cursed Spume
description: Cursed Spumes are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Blue Fokka
description: Blue Fokka are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Wizard
description: Wizards are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Cranioc
description: Craniocs are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Mothula
description: Mothula is a recurring Enemy in The Legend of Zelda series. It made its first appearance in A Link to the Past as the Boss of the Skull Woods. It would later take on a smaller role as a mini-boss, and afterwards as a common enemy.

name: Cukeman
description: Cukemen are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are strange enemies that are the result when Link sprinkles Magic Powder or uses a Mystery Seed on a Buzz Blob, transforming it into this creature. Cukemen are notable as being able to converse with Link, and will usually give him confusing advice about the game and various things in it.

name: White Lizalfos
description: White Lizalfos are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Dark Fog
description: Dark Fog is a trap in Twilight Princess.

name: Blue Bokoblin
description: Blue Bokoblins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Blue-colored Bokoblins appear in The Wind Waker and Twilight Princess, but are unnamed and known as their default color variants.

name: Moink
description: Moinks are Animals in Spirit Tracks.

name: Tektite
description: Tektites are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Blizzrobe
description: Blizzrobes are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Terrorpin
description: Terrorpins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: White Daira
description: White Daira are Minibosses in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Monkey
description: Monkeys are a recurring species in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Red Skulltula
description: Red Skulltula are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Black Wolfos
description: Black Wolfos are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Totem Deku
description: Totem Dekus are enemies in Tri Force Heroes. They are a variant of Deku Scrubs.

name: Totem Armos
description: Totem Armos are enemies and vehicles in Tri Force Heroes. They are a variation of the Armos which other enemies, as well as the Links, can ride on in the form of a Totem.

name: Black Stalfos Mage
description: Black Stalfos Mages are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Shadow Kargarok
description: Shadow Kargaroks are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Life Like
description: Life Likes are enemies in Tri Force Heroes. They are a smaller variant of the Like Like, and can be compared to the Rupee Like.

name: Water Tektite
description: Water Tektites are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Wooden Shield Moblin
description: Wooden Shield Moblins are Enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Shabom
description: Shaboms are enemies in Ocarina of Time.

name: Black Puffstool
description: Black Puffstools are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Black Hinox
description: Black Hinox are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Yook
description: The Yook are a hairy, club-wielding species who live on the Isle of Frost in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Red Hardhat Beetle
description: Red Hardhat Beetle are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Young Gohma
description: Young Gohmas, also known as Gohma Larvae, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sea Urchin
description: Sea Urchins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Black Bokoblin
description: Black Bokoblin are enemies in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Zolgel
description: Zolgels, also known as Gelzols, are enemies in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They are aggressive gelatinous blobs that shoot damaging jelly at Tingle and slowly move away from him. They all behave the same and usually appear in small groups of two or three, but vary in strength and the items they drop.

name: Slarok
description: Slaroks are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.  They are deformed creatures that bear a resemblance and behave similarly to Octoroks, as they spit rocks to attack from their snouts. In A Link to the Past and A Link Between Worlds, they are the Dark World and Lorulean counterpart of the Octorok.

name: Red Chuchu
description: Red Chuchus, also known as Red Chus, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sardak
description: The Sardaks are the mini-bosses of the Shrine of Earth.

name: Spiketrap
description: Spiketraps, also known as Rolling Pins, are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series. Spiketraps go unnamed in A Link to the Past, Link's Awakening, Ocarina of Time, Majora's Mask, Oracle of Seasons, The Minish Cap, Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks, and Tri Force Heroes.

name: Face Lamp
description: Face Lamps are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Bit
description: Bits are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Bait
description: Bait is a recurring type of item in The Legend of Zelda series. They are various kinds of items that are used to lure enemies and sometimes certain types of animals.

name: Geozard
description: Geozards are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Garo
description: Garo, also known as Garo Robes, are enemies in Majora's Mask.

name: Big Poe
description: Big Poes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are a larger, stronger variant of Poes. Like Poes, they carry Poe Souls within the lanterns that they carry.

name: Eye Slug
description: Eye Slugs are enemies in Phantom Hourglass. It is a small, snake-like creature that charges at Link during his journey through the Goron Temple. They also appear throughout the battle with Dongorongo trying to distract Link, as he is far removed from the actual battle by a river of sand, of which the Eye Slugs can cross. These foes usually appear in groups and are fast, although they can easily be defeated with a strike from Link's sword. If Link does manage to get hit by them, they deal minimal damage.

name: Staltroop
description: Staltroops are specialized enemies that appear only during Link's battle with Stallord at the Arbiter's Grounds in Twilight Princess.

name: Star
description: Stars are enemies in Link's Awakening.

name: Stone Talus
description: Stone Talus are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Big Baba
description: Big Babas are enemies in Twilight Princess. They are monstrous, giant relatives of the Deku Baba and Deku Like. They consist of a huge, weighty head on a giant thorny stem attached to a large bud. The bud in the center is actually the main body of the creature, while the stem and head reach out to attack intruders and drop items into the bud to be swallowed.

name: Stone Elevator
description: The Stone Elevator is a recurring living elevator that acts as an obstruction in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Frost Talus
description: Frost Taluses are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Electro Spume
description: Electro Spumes are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Miniblin
description: Miniblins are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Bari
description: Bari are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. If attacked, some variants of this enemy may split into smaller versions of themselves called Biri.

name: Stalizalfos
description: Stalizalfos are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Stone Blin
description: Stone Blins are enemies in Hyrule Warriors Legends.

name: Mini Freezard
description: Mini Freezards are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are the miniature version of Freezards; sometimes even the shattered remains of one. Mini Freezards appear as small chunks of ice commonly found on smooth, icy floors. When struck with the Sword, they quickly slide across the ice and ricochet off the walls or other obstacles, which can be difficult to avoid. As ice-based enemies, they are highly susceptible to fire-based attacks and blunt force.

name: Stalfos Knight Head
description: Stalfos Knight Heads are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Bad Bat
description: Bad Bats are enemies in Majora's Mask.

name: Kyandokyan
description: Kyandokyan are enemies in Oracle of Ages.

name: Key Master
description: Key Masters are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Mega Thwomp
description: The Mega Thwomp is an enemy in Link's Awakening. Its name and appearance is derived from the Thwomp enemies of the Mario series.

name: Stalfos
description: Stalfos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Aracha
description: Arachas are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Stalfos Knight
description: Stalfos Knights, also known as Skeleton Knights, are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series. They are a variety of exceptionally large, strong Stalfos armed with large blades.

name: Stalagmites and Stalactites
description: These ice formations, usually seen in caverns of sub-zero temperatures, appear fairly often in The Legend of Zelda series, although they only interact with the environment in Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask. Unlike ice chunks, stalagmites will not freeze Link when touched; they are simple barriers that can be destroyed using a Sword or another weapon. Occasionally, stalactites may fall on Link as he passes under them, causing him to take damage.

name: Stag Beetle
description: Stag Beetles are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Kodongo
description: Kodongos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are small reptilians with an appearance similar to a rhino or triceratops, much like a Dodongo.

name: Mau
description: Mau are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Spinut
description: Spinuts are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Karat Crab
description: Karat Crabs are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Magunesu
description: Magunesu are enemies in Oracle of Seasons.

name: Green Eyegore
description: Green Eyegores are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Green Darknut
description: Green Darknut are enemies in Twilight Princess.

name: Aneru
description: Aneru are enemies in The Adventure of Link. Its appearance is somewhat similar to that of a Rope, but its behavior is quite different.

name: Iron Ball
description: Iron Balls are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Magma Spume
description: Magma Spumes are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Green Bow Guard
description: Green Bow Guards are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Water Monster
description: Water Monsters are enemies featured in the "Fairies in the Spring" episode of The Legend of Zelda TV series. As the Royal Water Park is nearing completion, these monsters begin appearing and scare the workers away. When Link and Princess Zelda go to the park to investigate, they are attacked by a water monster that the young hero easily defeats with his Crissword. Later on, after the duo defeat an eel that almost drowned Zelda, both the princess and the hero are grabbed by two crab-like water monsters. Once they manage to defeat them, King Harkinian arrives to the scene but is soon grabbed by a tentacle that comes out of one of the pools and drags him in, although Link is unable to find the monster or the king.

name: Walltula
description: Walltula, also known as Skullwalltula, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Green Camo Goblin
description: Green Camo Goblins are enemies in Link's Awakening.

name: Yellow Stalfos
description: Yellow Stalfos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Pincer
description: Pincers are recurring worm-like enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. These monsters make deep holes their homes, burrowing deeper and deeper into the abyss to hide themselves from unwary victims. When an enemy approaches, its eyes will glow near the top of the hole for a split second before lashing out at prey or intruder. Link was able to destroy this beast by slashing it with his sword after luring it out of its hole. These beasts were also found to exist in both Holodrum and Labrynna.

name: Pikit
description: Pikits are enemies in A Link to the Past.

name: Goron
description: The Gorons , also known as the Goron Tribe, are a race of rock people inhabiting Hyrule, Termina, and several other countries, typically living in mountain ranges. They have been called "rock people" since ancient times, when the goddess Hylia ruled and have long held close ties with the Hyrulean royal family. They have the capability to thrive in any environment, and in times of crisis, have survived by migrating to different climes.

name: Yellow Octorok
description: Yellow Octoroks are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Vitamin Plant
description: Vitamin Plants are large venus flytrap-like creatures that appear on the First Continent in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland in the Deku Forest. Vitamin Plants, are nearly identical in behavior and appearance to their oceanic counterparts the Oysters, although Vitamin Plants are green. Instead of pearls, Vitamin Plants hold Recipes and even people. If fed scrap broth, Vitamin Plants turn them into Forest Vitamins after a certain amount of time. Tingle must be cautious not to have them clamp down on him, causing him to lose 15 Rupees. Tingle can be freed from the Plant's grip by tapping it with the stylus.

name: Phyrandaii
description: Phyrandaii are enemies that appear in the Philips CD-i games The Faces of Evil and The Wand of Gamelon.

name: Spike
description: Spikes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Spikes go unnamed in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Yellow Bari
description: Yellow Bari are enemies in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Twinmold
description: Twinmold is the Boss of Stone Tower Temple in Majora's Mask. The colossal monster is responsible for all of the curses placed on Ikana Canyon, and is keeping the last of the Four Giants captive. Twinmold's body is protected by an exoskeleton that leaves only its head and tail exposed.

name: Spider
description: Spiders are enemies in The Faces of Evil.

name: Pig
description: Pigs are recurring Animals in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sandfish
description: Sandfish are enemies in Tri Force Heroes. They are skeletal fish that appear to be the dry-land counterpart of the Skullfish.

name: Snow Octorok
description: Snow Octoroks are enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Reapling
description: Reaplings are enemies in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Sonic Wizzrobe
description: Sonic Wizzrobes are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Sluggula
description: Sluggula are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Rope
description: Rope are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Snurglar
description: Snurglars are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Rat
description: Rats are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are shadow-dwelling creatures, preferring dank, maze-like sewers, holes in walls, and dark rooms.

name: Quadro Baba
description: Quadro Baba are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Snapper
description: Snappers are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Rock Octorok
description: Rock Octoroks, also known as Octoroks , are recurring enemies in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Goriya
description: Goriyas, also known as Red Goriyas, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are devils that have mastered the Boomerang as a weapon, making them dangerous in both short- and long-range combat.

name: Goo Specter
description: Goo Specters are enemies in Link's Awakening DX.

name: Golden Rope
description: Golden Ropes are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Purple Moblin
description: Purple Moblins are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: ReDead Knight
description: ReDead Knights are enemies in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Golden Bokoblin
description: Golden Bokoblin are enemies in Breath of the Wild. They are exclusive to the Master Mode included in The Master Trials DLC Pack.

name: Earth Guardian
description: Earth Guardians are enemies in Skyward Sword.

name: Golden Octorok
description: Golden Octoroks are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Red Wizzrobe
description: Red Wizzrobes are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Dexivine
description: Dexivines are plant-like enemies in The Wind Waker.

name: Golden Bee
description: The Golden Bee, originally known as the Good Bee, is a recurring animal and item in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Force Soldier
description: Force Soldiers are an enemy introduced in Four Swords Adventures. They are a large Force Gem in the form of an enemy Soldier.

name: Pesto
description: Pestos are enemies in The Minish Cap.

name: Dodongo
description: Dodongos  are recurring enemies in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Gohmaracas Larva
description: Gohmaracas Larva are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Flying Snake
description: Flying Snakes are enemies that appear in The Faces of Evil.

name: Deku Like
description: Deku Likes are enemies in Twilight Princess. They are stationary, carnivorous plants that share traits with Deku Babas and Like Likes.

name: Peahat Larva
description: Peahat Larvae are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Floormaster
description: Floormasters, also known as Floor Masters, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Parutamu
description: Parutamu are enemies in The Adventure of Link. They are a stronger variant of the Stalfos, distinguished by the horned helmet they wear.

name: Igneo Pebblit
description: Igneo Pebblits are miniature versions of the Igneo Talus in Breath of the Wild.

name: Paralyzing Fog
description: Paralyzing Fog is a trap in The Wind Waker.

name: Pairodd
description: Pairodds are enemies in Link's Awakening.

name: Ice Elemental
description: Ice Elementals are enemies in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Fire
description: Fires, also known as Flames, are recurring Objects in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Orange Leever
description: Orange Leevers are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. Orange Leevers go unnamed in Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch.

name: Fire Eye
description: Fire Eyes are recurring traps in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Orange Goriya
description: Orange Goriyas are enemies in The Adventure of Link.

name: Oinker
description: Oinkers are pig-like enemies that appear in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They are fought like mini-bosses and their defeat often leads to finding an item of great worth. They are invulnerable to attacks as long as they are not stunned when running into obstacle like a wall or another Oinker.

name: Hyu
description: Hyu are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sir Frosty
description: Sir Frosties are enemies in Spirit Tracks.

name: Hinox
description: Hinox are recurring enemies and Sub-Bosses in The Legend of Zelda series. They are Cyclops-like ogres that have an affinity for Bombs, and commonly use them as weapons against Link. They typically appear as musclebound, light brown humanoids with a single eye and a ponytail. In most games, they are significantly weak to Bomb explosions.

name: Mad Bomber
description: The Mad Bomber is an enemy in Link's Awakening.

name: Odolwa
description: Odolwa is the Boss of Woodfall Temple in Majora's Mask. He is a tall, tribal blade dancer whose body is covered in tattoos. He wields a gigantic Sword several times the size of Link. Odolwa imprisoned one of the Four Giants, as well as the Deku Princess, within his temple. Odolwa is also the culprit behind the sad state of Woodfall, as well as the waters of the Southern Swamp becoming poisonous.

name: Silver Lynel
description: Silver Lynels are centaur-like enemies in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lorule Soldier
description: Lorule Soldiers are enemies that appear in A Link Between Worlds. They are the Lorulean counterpart to the Soldiers found dutifully protecting Hyrule Castle prior to Yuga sealing it in his dark Barrier. They appear in several different varieties. The soldiers found in the Dark Ruins act as sentries which must be avoided, whereas the soldiers in Lorule Castle act as regular enemies.

name: Helmasaur
description: Helmasaurs, also known as Iron Masks, and Hiploops, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Skulltula
description: Skulltulas are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lizalfos
description: Lizalfos are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Shy Guy
description: Shy Guys are enemies in Link's Awakening. Their appearance and name are directly based on the Shy Guy enemies from the Mario series.

name: Toado

Hyrule Historia states that the evil thoughts and resentment of Ganondorf, who had been killed by an earlier incarnation of Link in Twilight Princess, manifested through the Dark Mirror in the form of Link. He is possibly related to Dark Link, but has distinct differences in behavior, origin and appearance, making any relationship between them unclear and speculative.

They are large, Cyclops-like creatures with tough defenses that make them impervious to most attacks, with their key weak spot being their single eye. Eyegores are weak to projectile weapons, especially to the Bow and Arrows, which in some cases are the only weapons that will inflict any damage onto them.

They are notable for their extreme resilience and elasticity. They consist of a round, bouncy shell-like bell atop a mass of tentacles that it uses to creep about the various rooms and hallways throughout the dungeons in several Zelda titles. They commonly inhabit tower-like regions and appear alongside Bumpers and pitfalls.

While they were originally normal enemies, they began to serve larger roles in subsequent games in the series, acting as boss or mini-boss. Their first appearance shows them as having an elongated segmented body, with two appendages per segment and a single eye complete with iris; later games show them as clearly having two compound eyes and no appendages, giving them a more worm-like appearance.

The best method to battle these enemies is to use a Bodyguard or stun them with a Bomb. They usually drop Tough Meat.

name: Buzz Blob
description: Buzz Blobs are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They appear to be quivering piles of a jelly-like substance, whose bodies are electrified and will shock Link if they are attacked with any melee weapon, such as the Sword, hence their name. Depending on the game, it may not take any damage while electrocuting its target.

name: Bubble
description: Bubbles, also known as Anti-Fairies, are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are flying skulls that are usually seen engulfed in flames. They appear primarily in dungeons.

name: Ice
description: Ice is a recurring theme in many titles of The Legend of Zelda series. It appears in many forms, sometimes as an obstacle for Link to overcome, as a mere hindrance, or even something to be used to Link's advantage. Ice and Snow are found in areas with sub-zero temperatures, and are a common occurrence during the Season of Winter in Holodrum, in cursed Snowhead, and in the Snow Realm. Ice has plot significance as well, as the entire Zora's Domain and the surrounding areas freeze in certain points of the plot of Ocarina of Time and Twilight Princess. The Zoras become encased in ice to be freed by Link on his quest. In Twilight Princess, the ice of Zora's Domain is thawed by warping the Molten Shard of Death Mountain to the area.

name: Bomb Hugging Squirrel
description: Bomb Hugging Squirrels are enemies in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. They appear in Steamy Marsh. As their names implies, they are squirrels that have taken to curling up on Bomb Fruit. They usually spend their time sleeping on the fruit; this is the best time to attack. Attacking at any other time runs the risk of the squirrel setting off the bomb. The Bomb Hugging Squirrel will explode with the bomb, causing damage to Tingle. They drop Bomb Fruit when defeated.

They are among the strongest of enemy Soldiers, whose whirling flails makes them difficult to approach and can inflict heavy damage. Of all the enemy Soldiers, they are also the most common throughout the series.

Arrows are useless against the Boomerang Demons, but weapons such as a dagger can easily defeat these monsters.
